author: {'steamid': '76561199020789690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5324, 'playtime_at_review': 13874, 'last_played': 1712493365}
review:
I'll just say that this game used to be better than it is now. They have made some terrible changes, mostly with the AI. In skirmish mode it is so stripped down that it just runs around aimlessly and dying, and in conquest mode it is so overpowered as to be impossible on some missions in extreme difficulty. The AI basically cheats, it builds a relic and has a massive army within the first year, all without mining any iron or not possibly having the resources to build it all.

In the conquest mission "surrounded" it's 3 vs 1 against you, and within a few minutes of starting the enemy is right beside your starting tile and already attacking your territory before you have a single soldier. It's just lame honestly, there's no sense of a challenge, it's just straight up cheating AI. One set of mechanics for it, another for you, and they are not even remotely equal.

There are other conquest missions equally unbalanced in extreme mode especially, and these are the ones where you have a couple of years win it. In the "Gates of Helheim" mission you have to capture and hold 3 gates that endlessly spawn fallen valkyrie enemies, which kill your warriors in two hits. It's impossible to build up enough troops within two years to have a chance of holding one of these gates. So many other flaws I'm not even going to bother with, but these are the main ones. Another mission with the dwarves where you're swarmed by like 20 of them over and over again, in extreme mode it's impossible. 5 years to win? What a joke. I have tried countless times and even with a hero and 20 troops it can't be done. Even shield bearers are dead in 3 seconds. Again, lame.

If you like feeling like playing a game where the AI is cheating the entire time and having no immersion because of it, this is definitely the game for you! I find my time on this game frustrated and angry, and if a game does that it's not worth playing because the devs have completely missed the point of a game. The campaign is fun and definitely the only good part of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030123832', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 301, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1712420985}
review:
At first glance, Northgard looks like a neat little RTS. It takes a bit from Age of Empires and a bit from Warcraft 3, blending them together in a Viking-themed hodgepodge with a modern coat of paint.

Unfortunately, it doesnâ€™t take long for the cracks in the gameplay to show. Despite the few unique innovations, you canâ€™t escape the feeling that youâ€™re just playing a slower Warcraft 3 with a far more boring story. â€œAvenge your father and save the worldâ€ has to be the most tired trope imaginable for a game campaign. You really have to do more than just rip off the golden oldies if you want to impress.

It would be bad enough if the mechanics were simply derivative, but theyâ€™re often poorly executed. Your lords are very boring, with no additional abilities beyond more health and damage. The AI is absolutely braindead and can only pose a threat through artificial advantages. Each map plays out more or less identically, and at a pace that is more soporific than entertaining.

Also, are they actually joking with this pricing? Itâ€™s worth ten dollars less, and the amount of mid content that the devs have locked up behind overpriced DLC is staggering. Itâ€™s the kind of naked greed that will immediately put me off a company - I will remember the name Shiro Games, but not positively.

My advice would be to skip Northgard. Itâ€™s a cynical and shallow attempt at maximizing capital, with little brain and even less heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043246166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5340, 'playtime_at_review': 5008, 'last_played': 1712331119}
review:
While not perfect, this game is a ton of fun. I intended to spend my spring break being productive and played this for 60 hours instead.

Campaign: Pretty fun, only done half so far, but I like the challenges and harder difficulties.

Multiplayer: Tons of fun. I play with my friends every night, multiple win conditions and tons of clan options really makes things fun. I will say that the Competitive mode queue times are really long bc of the low player base, so I haven't actually played it, but on YT I've seen there's a meta that is quite unlike how me and my friends play.

Cosmetics: Free in-game cosmetics for completing missions is nice, not super insane, but kinda neat.

Conquest Mode: Haven't played it yet, but most of my friends play it when they're alone and say it's really fun

DLC: 5 dollars for a clan is a lot imo, but I put in 83 hours in 3 weeks andd got the game on sale so I figured I liked it enough to justify buying some of it. I would say overall the game and DLC are worth buying on sale, but I wouldn't advise anyone who isn't SUPER into the game to get DLC full price. 

Other thoughts:

I played a LOT of Civ and SCII and this is like a viking hybrid of the two. I know there are many other games in this genre, but I haven't played them to compare. I think if you want to get really good at one clan that can be fun, but I enjoy trying all the clans a few times in a rotation. 

Literally my biggest complaint about the game is that the playerbase is so small that there are only like 5 YouTubers I can find that still post content and a lot of older content isn't as helpful bc of patches that come out, so learning advanced mechanics not taught in the tutorials is a challenge.

I highly recommend this game, but I also acknowledge it may have superior competitors I simply have not played. The fact that they're doing more DLC and big free updates come with each DLC (even if you don't buy it) after 6 years is a good sign to me of the games health albeit with a small playerbase.

author: {'steamid': '76561199181008654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1711101845}
review:
I actually wasn't expecting to enjoy this game as much as I have but Northgard has been ALOT of fun for a game that lets me sit back and just chill for a bit! Still learning the game a bit but after completing a few challenges and attempts I'm intrigued to continue with more storylines! 

Love the soundtrack in this game! The difference of playstyles and ways to adapt to certain environments and enemies has been fun to learn as you progress! It's nice that each playthrough offers something different and a new way to thrive in your environment! Totally worth a try and playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561199651440299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 218, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1712422308}
review:
a rather fun and intuitive RTS game, which eases you into it's intricacies but does not hold back it's challenges should you elect to pursue them. it offers diverse problems to solve in it's resource acquisition and upkeep maintenance, and rewards the skilled player for understanding the systems involved. the factions are diverse and augment play in interesting and diverse ways, and the studio responsible continues to update with both balance patches and major gameplay updates.

As an older guy, I worried at the death of the RTS as a genre when starcraft 2 perished ignominously, defeated by a sparkly horse cosmetic. It seems that a number of studios are involved in keeping the genre alive, and this is an able, compelling, nuanced, and most importantly, cultivated and curated entry into the genre, which will hopefully be nurtured for some time to come. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198048959811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1631, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1712422325}
review:
Fun and interesting twist on the classic real-time-strategy genre.

Find a way to balance resource demands in the harsh winters of the frozen north while keeping your people happy, trading with (or conquering) your neighbors, and exert your dominance!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986967102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 926, 'playtime_at_review': 2506, 'last_played': 1711888969}
review: Main storyline is fine but the game has a hectic amount of depth and replayability where it wasnt expected (with the conquest mode or PvP). Great game, would recommend when its on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028239376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1650002993}
review: So, I really love the charm and aesthetic of the game, theres core mechanics that are refreshing and implemented in a cool way. Whats NOT cool is calling this an RTS because arguably it is not. For it to be RTS there has to be strategy, and there is none. It is a strict economy builder that has lots of factions, all of which allow no flexibility of implementing your own play style and strategy, which most RTS's are big on. So maybe for the single player story sure, but multiplayer always feels outclassed as you don't need to just learn a strict path of your favorite clan, but everyone's or else you will just get creamed by some sweaty 900+ hour basement dweller.

review: It's pretty good. Reminds me of the underrated Tilted Mill game Hinterland, which I loved. I'm not interested in multiplayer and so far have only played the story mode, and I have to say the story is nothing to write home about. And it's rather easy... I've never had an AI player actually challenge me at all. But, it's relaxing just to listen to the chopping of wood. Brings me back to simpler times.

Many bugs, really frustrating if you are playing for 30 minutes plus... then suddenly town hall stop producing villager with 10 happiness really?, scout cant reveal a tile ... etc. Sorry I should have recommend this game even with bugs.

review:
Northgard is a real gem! It's a strategy game that takes you on a Viking adventure, and it's packed with fun. The game's got a cool mix of base building and resource management, all set in a world that's rich with Norse mythology.

The game's pace is slower than your typical RTS, which gives you time to really think about your strategy. And the winter season adds a whole new level of challenge.

The graphics might not be flashy, but they're clean and do a great job of creating an immersive environment. And the developers are constantly updating the game, which is always a good sign.

All in all, Northgard is a must-play for any strategy game fan. It's a unique take on the genre that offers a ton of depth and replayability. Two thumbs up!

review:
Who is this game for?
Basically someone who doesn't mind a shallow, dry storyline with the fascination that barely exceeds watching paint dry.
But whom doesn't mind a fairly easy going game for kicking back and relaxing while doodling around with various things.
It, basically is what "feel good movies" are for stratergy games. 

TLDR; this game is for someone who wants a pretty chill gaming experience without needing to strain too much brain power. Unfortunately for me, that's not my cup of tea, despite the game not being terrible.

review:
Sehr langsames Age of Empires wenn man es kurz fassen mÃ¶chte.
Man ist leider an die Produktionsgeschwindigkeit der Arbeiter gebunden und das merkt man im Midgame wo alles etwas trÃ¤ge wird. Dadurch ist es aber auch AnfÃ¤ngerfreundlich und nicht so bestrafend wie ein AoE Titel wenn man einen Fehler macht.

Coole Story, leider etwas einseitig, weil man immer das selbe machen muss um zum Sieg zu kommen. 
(Kaum variation in GebÃ¤uden und Einheiten auÃŸer vom Main Character) 

Die einzelnen VÃ¶lker merkt man zwar im Spielstil, aber irgendwie kommt man am Ende trotzdem immer auf den gleichen Nenner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016822796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8881, 'last_played': 1710786104}
review:
Ein Fesselndes RTS-Erlebnis mit Endlosen MÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r Koop-Spieler

Northgard ist ein faszinierendes Echtzeit-Strategiespiel, das auf Steam eine treue Fangemeinde gefunden hat. Nachdem ich Ã¼ber 150 Stunden in die Welt von Northgard eingetaucht bin, kann ich mit Sicherheit sagen, dass dieses Spiel eine beeindruckende Erfahrung bietet, vor allem im Koop-Modus mit einem Freund.

Als jemand, der jeden Clan gemeistert und alle Eroberungen errungen hat, finde ich mich nun in der Warteschleife, auf ein neues Addon und neue Clans zu hoffen. Doch selbst nach all den Stunden bleibt Northgard eine Quelle der Unterhaltung und Herausforderung.

Die wahre SchÃ¶nheit von Northgard offenbart sich im Koop-Modus, wo du und ein Freund gemeinsam eure KrÃ¤fte vereinen, um das Land zu erobern und gegen verschiedene Herausforderungen anzutreten. Die strategische Tiefe des Spiels wird noch verstÃ¤rkt, wenn man mit einem Partner zusammenarbeitet, um Ressourcen zu verwalten, Gebiete zu erobern und feindliche Angriffe abzuwehren.

Obwohl ich bisher noch keine Erfahrung mit dem Online-PvP-Modus gemacht habe, bin ich sicher, dass er genauso fesselnd ist wie der Koop-Modus. Die Vielfalt der Clans und die unterschiedlichen Spielstile bieten eine endlose Wiederspielbarkeit, und ich kann es kaum erwarten, diese Vielfalt auch im PvP zu erleben.

Die Entwickler haben einen groÃŸartigen Job gemacht, das Spiel kontinuierlich zu verbessern und zu erweitern, und ich bin zuversichtlich, dass Northgard noch lange Zeit ein fesselndes RTS-Erlebnis bieten wird. FÃ¼r Fans des Genres und vor allem fÃ¼r diejenigen, die gerne im Koop spielen, ist Northgard definitiv eine Empfehlung wert.

TL/DR: Winter Winter *Squirrel

author: {'steamid': '76561198057418028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1227, 'playtime_at_review': 31721, 'last_played': 1712430464}
review:
This is the most honest review about this game after 528h playing it that you will get.
It used to be a good game, balenced, fun, no quiters, honestly chill but ...

1year from now it has been downhill and today, I decided to for the first time to review this game.

The looks of the game is nice, but after so much time it is still quite buggy and laggy. Multiplayer? Forget it. They have this horible ranked option qeue that takes foreeeeever, impossible to play these days.

They keep adding options to report bugs this and that but they are honestly making it worse, whom ever is in charge of the latest updates sucks, this person knows nothing about user experience. You pay quite a lot for a game like this, it is not cheap, they charge you for every single extra stupid clan which normally are very unbalenced, and still they cannot provide a decent server for us to play multiplayer, not even p2p.

Just horible, I had a lot of fun in the early days of this game, but these days I would just say stay away, not worth your money and time, there are other options out there with developers and game designers that really care about their comunity. Not this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080651891', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10712, 'last_played': 1576190826}
review: This game used to be pretty fun but the devs fiddled with it too much. If you want confirmation for this simply look at the achievements and realize that some of them which were previously obtainable through normal play now require you to specifically play for them in matches designed to get them. The achievements which come to mind are Sheep Master "have three sheepfolds" (clan goat can only build 2 sheepfolds as of a patch so the only way to get this is to steal a third from another player) and Nothing personal "Raid a tile with regular mercenaries and a giant together" (you could previously do this but now the two are NOT allowed on the same tile if it is an enemy tile which is the whole point of raids so the only way to get this is to '''raid''' a neutral tile.) Were these mechanics game breaking? I don't know and I don't really care but I think it speaks to the myopic balancing decisions when these previously straight forward achievements now require you to set up the specific conditions for which they can occur solely to get them. I've seen achievements like this in previous games but to have a dev make changes which they should KNOW will make these more difficult and then not adjust the achievements themselves to match tells me of a lack of concern for player experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051599072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4806, 'last_played': 1710432222}
review:
An innovation in the RTS genre. It has the same camera and individual unit controls of a classic RTS, but with management and tech mechanics that feel like a 4X, while at the same time not being ludicrously slow in terms of building a military. Some clans also play much more like a classic, like Wolf Clan, while others are into research or faith buildings.
The campaign is short but it's a nice introduction to the game, there's a Conquest mode that feels like a roguelike randomized campaign that can be played coop, the multiplayer scene is not overly competitive, there's quite a few modding scenes already, and many unlockables. Steam says I've played this for 80 hours but it's actually a lot more than that because I played it on other pc's. 
I recommend this to anyone that likes strategy games.

review:
Questo gioco a me Ã¨ piaciuto moltissimo e continua a piacere grazie anche ai dev che continuano incessantemente a migliorare il gioco e ad aggiungere contenuti sempre nuovi, bilanciare i clan e migliorare il gameplay. Lo comprai nell'epoca d'oro che girava intorno ai vichinghi ed a Civilization e trovo che questo gioco sia un'ottima fusione di entrambi i mondi. Ovviamente Civilization Ã¨ meno frenetico in quanto il gioco si sviluppa intorno ai turni e questo Ã¨ RTS.
L'impegno nel bilanciare i clan e aggiungere nuove dinamiche al gioco Ã¨ il suo punto forte, secondo me.
Decisamente lo consiglierei ai miei amici (giÃ  fatto) poichÃ© ha sia una modalitÃ  storia, una modalitÃ  competitiva, una modalitÃ  multigiocatore ed una modalitÃ  privata dove poter divertirsi senza impegno (o con molto impegno, sta alle vostre intenzioni) con gli amici.

review:
You can't save game in multiplayer (If you are getting it for multiplayer and can't complete game in one session)

Got this for multiplayer -> started a game with friend -> had fun for an hour -> decided let's continue game later -> could not save the game for later -> :(

Overall game is really great though so recommended for single player!
Also multiplayer provided saving is not an issue for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027492858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6927, 'last_played': 1705960130}
review:
Decent RTS game aimed pretty small scale conflict (no armies of hundreds or even dozens of troops here). It goes on sale quite often, the dev has been pretty good at actually supporting the game, DLC's go on sale reasonably often as well, and are nice, but do not feel mandatory.
Managed to spend quite a bit of time on it on and off, so at least to me it has decent replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839438740', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 68534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 43, 'playtime_at_review': 68321, 'last_played': 1712432939}
review:
The game is unstable all the time. 

Every time a new patch is released, it breaks the game for the next week (at best). The servers are constantly unstable, you may not be loaded into the game for no reason, actions may take place with a delay of 20 seconds for no reason. 

Developers do not pay attention to player feedback.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206679980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 116, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1711409192}
review:
Voici mon Ã©valuation aprÃ¨s deux ou trois petites parties :

Une petite pÃ©pite dans l'univers des jeux de stratÃ©gie. Lore sympathique et colorÃ©, qui plaira Ã  ceux qui aiment la mythologie viking. La bande-son est envoÃ»tante et bien immersive. Mention spÃ©ciale pour la direction artistique et les graphismes mignons des personnages qui offre un cÃ´tÃ© assez dÃ©calÃ© Ã  un jeu qui reste assez exigeant dans sa conception. C'est qu'en matiÃ¨re de ressources, il faudra non seulement accumuler bois, nourriture et or pour prospÃ©rer, mais en plus de gÃ©rer les ennemis, survivre Ã  l'hiver, le froid et la famine pouvant dÃ©cimer votre clan de faÃ§on aussi dÃ©vastatrice que les guerriers d'un clan hostile. NÃ©anmoins, la prise en main est intuitive et on comprend assez vite comment gÃ©rer les manques (bien mÃ©moriser les atouts du clan choisi en dÃ©but de partie vous aidera.

En ce qui concerne la baston ; le gameplay est efficace, vous crÃ©ez assez vite des bÃ¢timents militaires, mais il faut bien penser aux amÃ©liorations pour avoir plus de troupes si vous jouez de faÃ§on agressive. Mais je mets un point noir concernant la mini map, qui est parfois pÃ©nible Ã  lire quand on veut localiser ses territoires les plus Ã©loignÃ©s, car Ã  force de coloniser, on finit par en avoir beaucoup et il devient plus compliquÃ© de suivre tout ce qui se passe dessus quand on est attaquÃ© ou qu'un incendie se dÃ©clenche.

J'ai parlÃ© de la victoire militaire, Ã©tant donnÃ© que j'ai choisi un clan belliqueux, mais pour les pacifistes, vous pouvez aussi gagner par le commerce, le savoir ou la renommÃ©e. C'est le choix du clan et les bonus qui vont avec qui dÃ©cideront de votre stratÃ©gie. Notez que des petites bulles de tutoriel vous explique rÃ©guliÃ¨rement les diffÃ©rentes mÃ©caniques de jeu, ce qui fait que vous comprendrez assez vite, surtout si vous avez dÃ©jÃ  l'habitude des rts. Si vous Ãªtes dÃ©butant dans un jeu de ce genre, je pense qu'il est du coup Ã©galement idÃ©al pour dÃ©couvrir le genre. 

Tout cela pour dire : je recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014661914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 50078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 47, 'playtime_at_review': 49665, 'last_played': 1711645143}
review:
Gave me hope for RTS and the modern gaming industry in general.

+ Good gameplay with interesting mechanics or twist on established ones
+ Clans play very differently without drowning you in 'extra mechanics'. Permutations and/or small variations on well thought out core mechanics offer great replayability.
+ Lots of content, fairly priced DLCs, good update-cycle
+ Good looks and sounds. In general a high amount of 'wow, there was love poured into this'-moments.
+ Coop-Conquest Mode is the most fun I had in an RTS

+/- Less hectic than SC2 or AoE2. I really like it, but I can see APM-freaks being turned off by the limited micro.

- Sometimes lobbies bug out (didn't happen since the last update so maybe fixed?)
- Please send help for some clans extreme-AI. It has some sort of brain-damage, carbon mono-oxide poisoning or crippling depression. Either way, please help it.


Overall well worth checking out. Great potential for a comfort-game.
I'm seeing myself dumping another 827+ hours on this gem.

I'd rate it a high JÃ¶tunn. Closer to a Dwarf than a Myrkalfar.

review: Nice strategy game, beautiful design, more complex than it appears with multiple game modes. Played with a friend as co-op and we already have 60 hours and still more to play and discover. So far, conquest co-op mode is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085047367', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4068, 'playtime_at_review': 7431, 'last_played': 1712413010}
review:
This is the overall simplest and slowest RTS I can imagine while also having a ton of depth to it's mechanics and features such as higher environmental difficulties in addition to just AI difficulty, a long campaign with bonus objectives holding replay value, and an expanding (through DLC) variety of play-styles in the form of playable clans.
Highly recommended for new RTS players and veterans alike in the same lobbies, I play this with my friend who loves Starcraft 2 and Age of Empires 3 while I do not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044770769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6204, 'last_played': 1710861962}
review: This game is amazing in its first couple dozen of hours, but soon it becomes glaringly obvious that it is a very casual strategy game. Solo game on lower difficulties is too easy, and on higher difficulties it is forcing you to play slowly and completing a map will take you hours. It is also frustrating that producing military units is directly hurting your economical development as units are recruited from villagers, that could have otherwise been assigned to resource producing buildings. If you lose your army you have to pull back villagers producing other resources and spend significant amount of gold to replenish it. This double dipping leads to a quick snowballing effects that make it very punishing when you try to expand and border multiple factions that can attack you at the same time. There are just far too many quirks that over time grow on you and make the game frustrating to enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086168113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3136, 'playtime_at_review': 49654, 'last_played': 1712483378}
review:
Northgard is a game which I do really enjoy, while its player-base might be small it CAN still be a great game. However, it has recently been AWFUL. It takes up to an hour to get into a ranked game where you would hope to know you're going to have a fun competitive game of similar skilled teammates and enemies. It consists of completely unfair matchmaking, causing your game to be lost the second you enter.

On top of this, there are SEVERAL bugs with trying to find a lobby which are incredibly frustrating, especially when I really enjoy the gameplay but the developers lie to you patch after patch. They say things are fixed when they're not and continue to push out new content and DLCs without fixing the fundamentals of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199378920297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 581, 'playtime_at_review': 34576, 'last_played': 1712434685}
review: The game has never been 100% stable if you want to play it online with other players, however after the recent patches it got terrible. It`s almost impossible to join FFA game. The idea and mechanics are great, however it all is ruined by terrible support and bugs.

review:

O fator da empresa manter o jogo constantemente atualizado, faz o conteÃºdo extra ser atrativo (quando em promoÃ§Ã£o). A adiÃ§Ã£o de co-op para o Modo Conquista (Conquest) ficou excepicional. Esse jogo tem pontos positivos primordiais: 
- Exige pouco hardware (perfeito pra quem tem notebook)
- NÃ£o precisa de conexÃ£o de internet para jogar a campanha ou modo Conquista (quando fiquei sem internet foi o jogo que me restou) 
- A campanha Ã© um tutorial muito intuitivo

O jogo Ã© um pouco repetitivo e cansativo devido o comeÃ§o lento em cada partida, mas no decorrer Ã© divertido na companhia de amigos. Vale a pena!

author: {'steamid': '76561199205531899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1710173048}
review:
QoL < other games in genre...

Poor explanation of mechanics, sometimes you can't do something and no explanation of why.  For example, new player I spent a while trying to attack an enemy but couldn't figure out why wasn't working.  One time the area wasn't scouted, other times the map was really weirdly shaped and there was another territory I needed to go thru first.  Finally I figured it out but to a WHILE, why is there no simple tooltip like "this area hasn't been scouted yet" NOPE just won't let you click...

Not letting you do something but not telling why is VERY annoying.  This may seem petty but other examples are the same.  Seems they care more about pumping new clans out to take money than actually putting thought into the player's experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002170706', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1710348113}
review:
I'm giving it a thumbs up, but the game does not have a lot of replayability. It gets pretty boring pretty quick due to how easy it is (singleplayer).

The game needs serious balancing AND AI improvements for late game. It's just too easy at the moment.
I started playing on normal difficulty for my first ever game, and despite not knowing anything, annihilated all AI factions within a couple of hours.

Second game on hard, same story. Third game on "extreme" difficulty, even easier than before now that I roughly know what I'm doing.

You just steamroll the AI once you establish a reliable food source and build a couple of breweries, which isn't at all hard to do. And the only defence anyone has against an invading army is to have an equal or superior army to counter it. Yes, you can build defence towers, but it's limited to one per "tile" and they are virtually useless unless they come at you one guy at a time. Which they don't (not counting the singular wild enemies present in neighbouring "tiles" that come once in a blue moon).

Few things that would help are;

[b]1- Make the AI more proactive in defending but more importantly, attacking.[/b] I've had two games in hard and extreme difficulty, where their armies just hang around doing nothing.

[b]2- Make it impossible to capture the enemy's town hall without capturing every other territory they own.[/b] It's rather ridiculous to take out an entire faction, sprawling half the map, by only taking out its town hall.
This is not a solution to the main issue here mind you, but at least it makes it take longer to defeat an enemy.

[b]3- Random disasters should be more impactful.[/b]
They are merely a nuisance even at the game start. They have practically no impact in the mid-to-late game.
Except the rat infestation event. That can be a big issue during early stages.

[b]4- Have more varied and impactful defensive options.[/b] There's no way to field an effective defence in the game unless you build a superior army, and because it is so easy to take over a tile and get to the enemy's town hall, losing one battle effectively means you lose the game. That's just unfathomable. The game needs other ways to field a defence other than just a bigger army than the other guy. I don't want to play a military path every match lest I forfeit the game.

Haven't been successful in joining a multiplayer session yet. I imagine it'll be a lot more challenging playing against human players and where this game will be saved in my eyes. 
But speaking for singleplayer gameplay; it's fun for a few hours, but the AI and late-game buffs need to be rebalanced to make the game more challenging and have replayability. 
I've played 3 games since yesterday and I don't think I'll ever touch singleplayer again.

[b]Edit:[/b] Played a number of multiplayer games since the above review. The issues with late game efficiency imbalance and the inability to resist an attacking army without an equal or superior army of your own remains the same, forcing you to play a specific style every match if you don't want to be steamrolled. More often than not, losing a single battle means your game is doomed. If anything, this is more pronounced in multiplayer because other will take advantage of the situation very quickly.

So I'm going to have to revise the review as "not recommended".

review:
Ich wÃ¼rde dem gerne eine Positive Bewertung geben, wenn nicht dieses Problem mit dem Map Editor wÃ¤re.

Das Spiel ist echt Klasse, macht super SpaÃŸ. hier ne 10/10 in jedem Aspekt.

Jetzt kommen wir leider zu dem Punkt weshalb ich es nicht empfehlen kann...

Fangen wir erstmal damit an das JEDER neue Clan Geld Kostet, okay hÃ¤tte man anders machen kÃ¶nnen, aber in der heutigen Welt ist das scheinbar normal.... Nun kommt das Problem,  dass wenn ich eine Map erstelle.. mein Mate, GENAU DIE CLANS BRAUCHT DIE AUF DER MAP SIND, HAAR GENAU und der Grund liegt einfach darin.. DER Entwickler zwingt dadurch Leute zum kaufen dieser Clans. FÃ¼r mich einfach n dreistes Unterfangen und nicht nachvollziehbar, auf Nachfrage im Discord warum man im Map Editor nicht einstellen kann, dass der Spieler den Clan auswÃ¤hlt, wird man mit schweigen belohnt. 
TatsÃ¤chlich ist dieser Map Editor eine Schande fÃ¼r jedes RTS game. Sollte sich das in der Zukunft Ã¤ndern, bin ich gerne bereit hier was Positives zu schreiben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136631267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 48912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3396, 'playtime_at_review': 42873, 'last_played': 1712445034}
review: I've been playing this game for the whole year, and now it is made totally unplayable. I was searching the lobby for half of hour. After the last "fixing" update it become even worser. I pretty like gameplay: it is very variable, almost every clan has different tactics for different types of game (fast, middle, long), it very depends on your mind, but there is also some random, which doesnt give the game to turn into the checkmates. But still, it is literally unplayable, because you can't start the game! But the worst is that if even you start the game, you can just disconnect before the very beginning and loose rating. And you can't even rejoin, if you were disconnected too early. Now the game is just broken.

review:
Okay single player, campaign.  (8/10)
Awful multiplayer. (2/10) Low online, ranked full of smurfs on new accounts, NO REPLAYS in 2024 LOL,  pay to win clans. Ladder opponent search can give you opponent with x8 times more hours (200h vs 1600h) in game and x2 higher MMR. If you leave the lobby you dont want to play, you cant search game for some time and might lose some MMR also.  Really cool to scroll ladder list to the top for 10 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074930366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 126593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 984, 'playtime_at_review': 122653, 'last_played': 1712187952}
review:
I'll be honest I used to love this game. But now it feels less like a game and more like a part time job.

The ability for each merchant to carry their own stocks of stone letting you upgrade seamlessly and create a powerhouse of a clan is now practically impossible since no matter how many markets you build you still must wait since the resources are no longer individual but shared.

The AI enjoys getting stuck for no reason. As they have a large army and are only a few location slot away you can just move your forces into their main location and they don't bother moving causing an easy victory. Seems like we are going away from being a good game and into another grind and time waste. At this stage I wouldn't recommend the game as there are better strategy options out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114328082', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 176, 'playtime_at_review': 6840, 'last_played': 1712323484}
review: I really like the mechanics of this game, the art style, and how it's different than other RTS's. But that being said the AI is abysmal, and the worst part is, it wasn't always this bad, I assuming they just haven't done the necessary updates and tweaking with the addition of new factions and balances. IF the AI even manages to attack you or not die from wildlife by the 3rd year, they will give up and essentially sit idle, even when they have resources to attack or acquire more land (I completely surrounded an AI with 30 pop and over 1000 gold and left my borders undefended and they did not attack for 7 years until I won). They're entirely docile and are not substitutes for players, if anything they should be seen as neutrals on the map for real players to interact with. And that being said, there's not a wealth of players, and because of that you mostly get new players or people with 3000 hours, so it's hard to find a balanced match, there's not enough people for ranked matchmaking to properly sort you. But that's a fault of a lot of older matchmaking in general. The biggest issue is people play to the meta or whatever guide they follow and at the first upset they quit. So all of the win conditions are void because if you survive the meta all in attack on year 3 the enemy will just auto forfeit because they've devastated their economy and can't defend themselves against a counter attack. Or if someone is playing for a win condition the first bad winter they quit because they're just entirely playing off of a guide or they just have no interest in attempting to adapt or anything. If you have a match of real players that are willing to fight tooth and nail for victory this game is probably an 8 or 9/10. But playing against AI feels like a tech demo, and if you can manage to wait for a lobby to fill up you're likely getting super high ranked and super low ranked, and even if the teams are balanced all you have to do is survive the meta 803AD attack and the enemy will forfeit. This game is like a 2/10, low player numbers means poor matchmaking ranked or otherwise, and the AI do nothing on every difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993304247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 92, 'playtime_at_review': 15001, 'last_played': 1711839308}
review:
This game was amazing, and could still easily  be returned to that state, but now, after many good years, the AI appears significantly weakened, deteriorated to the point where previously capable opponents die to NPC wildlife. To make things worse, what used to be a solid performer in terms of latency and stability now crashes frequently, typically resulting in 1+ hour of lost gameplay. 

Fix this, and I would highly recommend this little gem. But as it is now, I'm very close to abandoning the well-raided coasts of Northgard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082680776', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 21325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 854, 'playtime_at_review': 12992, 'last_played': 1712408499}
review:
As an old school RTS enjoyer i was skeptical of the artsy graphics and simple looking gameplay. I couldnt have been anymore wrong. Ive somehow put over 200 hours into this game and i still find myself coming back to it.
If you find you dont enjoy the fast meta pace of multiplayer please try Conquest. It's easily the best part of this game and my only gripe is that they need more variation between runs. i have completed all the conquests on all characters but no reason to return to them as everyone run is basically the same interms of core missions. This game is fantastic though and all the DLC is worth it.

review: Solid take on a Viking style RTS game. Simple to learn, but difficult to master. Each clan plays very differently. Has multiple different ways and strategies to close out the game. Also, Shiro Games continues to pump out new content for this game. Overall a great introductory into RTS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045702105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4007, 'last_played': 1708884572}
review:
just as a plethora of other people will tell you, the single player is great and so is the Multiplayer.... With the Caveat that Multiplayer is only great when it WORKS. 
me and my friends have been playing on and off again since shortly after launch, but now the server connectivity issues have just ruined the experience for us. we'll be an hour or two into a campaign and then will will just loose it all because the server crashes. 
Which is a HUGE shame too because by all accounts, it is a GREAT game and even better with friends.

review: After almost 700 hours played, they deleted my progress in certain matches played and won with specific clans and my progress in the high king shield was also deleted showing me that I am a peasant again, even the matches won in the Stag clan where I made progress of 50 (more than 150 but the game is rewarding after 50 games) matches won. I will edit my review after I recover what I lost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069289243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2902, 'last_played': 1709993405}
review: A simple yet satisfying game. It at times feels very much like a board game in the best possible way. My only complaint is that they slightly tweaked my favorite team (Kraken).

author: {'steamid': '76561199220406249', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1711603208}
review: "Northgard" is an exciting strategy game that takes you deep into the world of scandinavian mythology and puts you at the head of a Viking settlement. Good graphics, addictive gameplay and a variety of opportunities for development make this game a real discovery for strategy lovers.

-----

ENG
Northgard is, in my opinion, one of the best modern RTS games.
First of all, I want to express my gratitude to Shiro Games, who continue to support their project year after year, while trying to listen to the players, and not forgetting to add new content.
I played on almost all clans, I can say that each clan has its own characteristics that are pleasant to study and subsequently interact, finding new synergies and tactics. The only problem is that, in fact, all the new clans that are introduced into the game are not balanced well enough at release, and many of them are subsequently nerfed so much that when playing PVP, players are not chosen at all due to their insufficient ability to compete with other clans.
Therefore, if I choose between PVP and PVE, I choose the second. Because online games are played mainly by strong players who have long conquered the online mode and especially in meta tactics and clans. Itâ€™s enough to look at what guides are on the Internet to understand how the local PVP mode works. The developers are still finalizing it to give it a new lease of life, since judging by the feedback from players online, PVP has signed up.
I consider â€œConquestâ€ to be my favorite of all the game modes; it was the one that breathed life into this game for me. When playing together, this mode reveals itself even better. But there are problems here too, because bots cannot complete some missions, because of this, the motivation to play disappears, since victory is achieved too easily and without a challenge. I assume this will be fixed in the coming patches, as well as the broken difficulties of bots.
If you bring your friends along, you can enjoy PVE or PVP modes together.
But let me remind you, since this is an RTS, the winner will be the one who knows how to play correctly, make quick decisions and do good microcontrol.
I was upset by the fact that after a series of updates my progress on victories for different clans was reset. It also seemed to me a very strange decision to add an additional single player company as a separate DLC, even though the Lion clan comes with it.
Separately, it is worth saying that the game has a Steam workshop, where players can post their work and support the project, plus to all this, the game has an open console and a map editor, where everyone can try their hand at map building and fine-tune various parameters for themselves .
To summarize, I want to say that I personally plan to return to this project from time to time, especially with the release of new clans. The game is suitable for those who want to relax and spend time with their friends, as well as for those who are going to try themselves in competition with other players for the title of â€œFastest Fingersâ€. Well, in order to comfortably enter the gameplay, a single company is presented, which acts as an introduction to the simple plot and familiarization with the different starting clans. Most likely, when playing PVE you will not pay attention to the balance, and rightly so, because the game has enough content to captivate you for more than a dozen hours.
